item.description:
Fredric Bastiat was a 19th century French law-maker, economist and author. The Law, has proven to be perhaps his most enduring from a modern political standpoint. Written in 1850, just two years after the French Revolution of 1848, the Law is part treatise and part polemic, an appeal to the French people reminding them of the proper sphere of the law and government and begging them to turn away from their descent into socialism.

Please join us for a lively discussion of this tiny book.  Is it still relevant today?  Is THE LAW talking about  Anarcho-capitalism?  Libertarianism? or is it just plain common sense when trying to avoid a full scale societal collapse?

Ron Paul had recommended that all American's read it during the Huckabee debate earlier this year.    Please join us!  FREE.

 

FREE AUDIO BOOK LINK HERE:

http://www.freeaudio.org/fbastiat/thelaw.html

FREE TEXT OF BOOK HERE: (make sure you scroll down)

http://bastiat.org/en/the_law.html

group.name: FREEDOM IS FUNDAMENTAL Book Club and Discussion Group

item.name: Discussion of THE LAW by Fredric Bastiat
